ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I became more competent in grammar, reading, and writing. Madame Bedoui encouraged our speaking/writing more idiomatically.

I feel like I have a greater grasp on speaking, writing, comprehension, as well as reading in French. My instructor also gave us a lot of historical as well as social insights onto french and francophone cultures.
Developed my overall foundation in french.
My idiomatic French improved tremendously!
This course taught me about several aspects of French syntax and grammar, including conjugations, cause/consequence, and pronoun use.

I learned a lot about French culture and history in general through this class. The readings were very well curated to explore different time periods in French history and understand important cultural aspects. We had many "rdactions," so I was able to improve my writing skills, and I appreciated the chance to practice my speaking skills through time set aside for casual conversations and when discussing the literature.
Writing essays in French, holding a conversation about intellectual topics, reading literature and understanding more complex texts. Learned about some historical stuff as well.
Ability to converse in french and communicate more complex ideas in french

Through this course, I learned how to more closely analyze works in French and write longer-length essays connecting several works together. I also was able to gain more confidence in my spoken French, especially through learning key vocab and phrases that improved the flow of my sentences.

I gained a ton more French vocabulary a got more comfortable conversing in French and reading literature and articles. It was also great to hear all my classmates' perspectives on the material we read and watched in class.
Passed Intermediate level of French (approaching B2).
My writing skills has improved immensely and learnt how to use french in more profound and intellectual contexts.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I think the improvement of writing was a strength while the course could do better in improving our speaking. Maybe if we did more class bonding activities or skits in the beginning of the year I would have been more comfortable practicing my speaking in class.
I think more opportunities to speak in groups would be helpful. Although this changed in the latter half of the class and I think the instructor found a good balance.

Strengths: 
Teaches grammar well, gives a lot of grammar practice. Strengthens your confidence in writing/syntax. Good reading workload.
Weakness:
I would've benefited from a greater focus on speaking, reading, and analyzing texts. Grammar homework load was very high.

The literature, movie and song selection in this course was excellent. Combined they did an excellent job highlighting aspects of French culture and history. I would have appreciated more time just to converse in French and greater discussion of the films/songs. I really like the rdactions and how we turned in two drafts so we really had the opportunity to improve our writing skills.

Strengths: read some cool French literature and watched some interesting films. 
Weaknesses: sometimes I felt underprepared for exams, but I suspect that had more to do with me than the professor.
I do not really see any weaknesses with the course

This course does a great job of solidifying one's understanding of grammar structures, to the point that they feel more intuitive to incorporate in one's writing and speech. The discussion-based format of the class encourages active engagement and practice through communicating one's ideas both in small groups and with the whole class. One thing about the class that could be improved is the amount of feedback given, particularly after assessments are handed backI think having more time to discuss common mistakes would have helped clarify the class's understanding of the material as a whole.

I think the course is structured well; I really like the revision aspect of writing assignments and the final project. I also really like the kind of hybrid lecture/seminar style of classes. The books we read and films we watched were also very captivating as were our class discussions. I think at times the workload could be a lot, especially with multiple assignments on some nights, and I would have preferred either shorter exams or more time to complete them.

Strengths:
-Class and seminar environment is well done
-Readings are well selected
-Homework is well done to facilitate learning of grammar
-Lot's of feedback on the essays, which is good

Weaknesses:
-Wish you could learn a bit more. I think it would be better to make this into L5 either a 1.5 credit course which meets everyday, or split it into an intro conversation course and an intro lit (before 160 and 170). I just wish there were more options for beginner L5 courses so that one could take more right away. If one reads a lot outside of class you can learn many words and such, but it would be great to have more class time.
I loved the course reading and materials but i believe it was too much! If students already deal with 3-4 other classes, it is too much to handle.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: If you want an encouraging environment to improve your French, this is a great course to take!
Yes! I feel as though I'm nearly fluent in French
I would recommend this class to a student who wants to improve their French language skills in grammar or who is seeking the certificate/major.
Absolutely! 10/10. The course provides wonderful exposure to French culture and the class becomes a community of friends.

If you want to continue to better your French learning skills, I would say this is definitely a class to take. Don't take this class if you're looking for an easy grade or easy language credit or if you aren't willing to be pushed out of your comfort zone, language-wise.
Absolutely, it is a great way to get more advanced technical work in the language

I would wholeheartedly recommend this course to any student who is looking to further develop how they express their ideas in French while also analyzing a lot of nuanced, thought-provoking media (novellas, films, plays). Getting a good grasp of grammar structures is definitely an important goal to have in the class, but it is all part of becoming a more fluent writer and speaker! Learning about the historical and social context for the media we discussed was also a highlight of the class.

I would totally recommend this class; it's a great baseline L5 class that solidifies grammar and introduces the nuance and greater insight of future L5 classes, with interesting material and assignments.
Yes, it is a great course to improve your French. My vocabulary and level of speaking has been greatly elevated.
Yes, I do!
